content:
Under the Lifestyle coverage, the Rental Car Excess benefit is $500 for the Basic plan, $750 for the Silver plan, $1,000 for the Gold plan, and $1,250 for the Platinium plan.
Under the Enhanced Medical Benefits for COVID-19, Overseas Medical Expenses for an Adult (age 70 years and below) are not available for the Basic plan, but are covered up to $50,000 for the Silver plan, $150,000 for the Gold plan, and $200,000 for the Platinium plan.
questions: What is the Rental Car Excess benefit for the Basic plan under Lifestyle coverage?
How much does the Silver plan cover for Rental Car Excess under Lifestyle coverage?
What is the maximum Rental Car Excess benefit available under the Platinium plan?
Are there any Overseas Medical Expenses benefits for COVID-19 for adults under 70 in the Basic plan?
How much does the Gold plan cover for Overseas Medical Expenses for COVID-19 for adults aged 70 and below?
What is the coverage limit for Overseas Medical Expenses under the Platinium plan for COVID-19?
Is there a difference in the Rental Car Excess benefit between the Gold and Silver plans?
What are the Overseas Medical Expenses benefits for an adult under the age of 70 in the Silver plan?
Can you explain the tiered benefits of the Rental Car Excess under the Lifestyle coverage?
What is the highest amount covered for Overseas Medical Expenses in the Enhanced Medical Benefits for COVID-19?
